pull.title: util: Don't reference errno when pthread fails.
pull.body:
Pthread library does not set errno.
Pthread library's errno is returned by return value.

events.body:
Concept ACK: nice catch and nice first-time contribution!

May I ask how did you found this issue? :)

Warm welcome as a contributor @miztake :)

ACK c7601aba89972f71464c9809cc3607b96b5975ab

you can move the declaration into the if statement like this:
`if ((int rc = pthread_setschedparam(pthread_self(), SCHED_BATCH, &param)) != 0) {`

ACK c7601aba89972f71464c9809cc3607b96b5975ab, tested on Linux Mint 19.3 (x86_64).

From the [`pthread_setschedparam()` docs](https://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man3/pthread_setschedparam.3.html):
> On success, these functions return 0; on error, they return a nonzero error number.

> you can move the declaration into the if statement like this:
> `if ((int rc = pthread_setschedparam(pthread_self(), SCHED_BATCH, &param)) != 0) {`

It won't compile :) (at least on GCC 7.5).

Hi, @practicalswift

> May I ask how did you found this issue? :)

Thank you for your comment.
I didn't actually output this log.
It's a common bug when using pthread and I found it in a code review.
( just greped "pthread" :) )

ACK 0e7b64b64db00d03489a72c988dc7ef53433f69d.

Mind squashing commits into one commit?
Concept ACK, checked `man pthread_setschedparam`, change seems correct, but commits should be squashed into one.

events.message:
util: Don't reference errno when pthread fails.

Pthread library does not set errno.
Pthread library's errno is returned by return value.

Co-authored-by: Hennadii Stepanov <32963518+hebasto@users.noreply.github.com>

events.body:
Hi, @kristapsk

Thank you for your comment.
I squashed the commits into one.
ACK cb38b069b0f41b1a26264784b1c1303c8ac6ab08, only squashed commits since the [previous](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/19194#pullrequestreview-425831739) review.

comments.body:
Hi, @hebasto

Thank you for suggesting change.
I accept your suggested change.
